intro: Petasites × sachalinensis, commonly known as the giant buttercup, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Asia and Europe. Due to its size and striking appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and is considered a rare and ornamental species.
